Darryl_&_Don_Ellis:
{{Infobox musical artist | name = The Ellis Brothers | image = Darrylanddon341165.jpg | caption = | image_size = | alias = | origin = [[Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania]] United States | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 1992–1994 | label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | past_members = Darryl Ellis Gatlin
Don Ellis Gatlin }} '''The Ellis Brothers'' Were an American [[country music]] duo formed in [[Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania]] in 1992. The duo consisted of brothers Darryl Ellis Gatlin and Don Ellis Gatlin. Their highest charting single, "No Sir," peaked at No. 58 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart in 1992. Don Ellis wrote songs on [[Blake Shelton]]'s first two albums, and later founded a second band called Savannah Jack.{{cite web|url=http://www.savannahjack.com/about.asp |title=Savannah Jack biography |work=Savannah Jack |accessdate=2009-10-23 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090607034848/http://www.savannahjack.com/about.asp |archivedate=June 7, 2009 }} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:10em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Album details ! colspan="2"| Peak chart
